intro: Achyranthes atropurpurea, commonly known as purple borage, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with purple or reddish hues. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and range in color from pale purple to white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
